text: Hello, I am interested in remote work or getting hired by some startup. I have Masters CS degree, but not really technical one( Combination with economics ). I work as an Android developer for 2 years, and I would like to know how to get better chance to get hired. Should I build my own apps and put them to playstore and git hub? Should I learn more about algorithms/data structures and basic CS? I was at an interview for a large company and I failed only because I didn’t know the deep stuff, like implementation of algorithms and complexity. Is this needed for all Andorid jobs or just proving I can create apps is enough? Thanks for any advice!
I'd say making good apps is a way to get noticed and knowing your textbook CS algorithms and concepts is what gets you through the interview
as much as I wish we didn't have to go through interviews like that, it's just how it is

>Should I build my own apps and put them to playstore and git hub? 

This is a great way to show your skills
thanks both of you, basically what I thought, but find the time to study all and create apps while working fulltime :simple_smile:
that's really what I hate about studying algorithms and such, I'm already trying to make apps in my spare time and now I have to divide up that time studying something I'll forget after the interview
even if it’s derivative or not the most innovative apps, just getting it out there and having a portfolio is a good way to show some experience
thanks, I was thinking a lot what interesting app I should create, but i will just create few apps in material design, and share the source on github and put them to play store
